gurmukhi: ijnY qoih iDAwieE iqnY pUrn pRqwp pwieE srb Dn Dwm Pl PUl moN Plq hYN ]
transliteration: Jinai Toh(i)dhiaaio Tinai Pooran Prataap Paaio Sarab Dhan Dhaam Phal Phool Son Phalat Hain||3||255||
translation: Those who meditated on Thee, they obtained perfect Glory, they obtained perfect Glory, they prosper greatly with wealth, fruit and flowers in their homes.3.255.

gurmukhi: dyv dyvqwn kO surys dwnvwn kO mhys gMg Dwn kO ABys khIAqu hYN ]
transliteration: Dev Devtaan Kau Sures Daanvaan Kau Mahes Gadg Dhaan Kau Abhes Kahooat(u) Hain||
translation: Thou art called Indra among gods, Shiva among the donors and also garbless though he wears the Ganges.

gurmukhi: rMg mYN rMgIn rwg rUp mYN pRbIn AOr kwhU pY n dIn swD ADIn khIAqu hYN ]
transliteration: Ran Main Ranoon Raag Roop Main Praboon Aur Kaahu Pain A Doon Saadh Adhoon Kahooat(i) Hain||
translation: Thou art the brightness in colour, adept in sound and beauty, and not low before anybody, but obedient to the saint.

gurmukhi: pweIAY n pwr qyj puMj mYN Apwr srb ibidAw ky audwr hYN Apwr khIAqu hYN ]
transliteration: Paanooai Na Paar Tej Pounj Main Apaar Sarab Bidiaa Ke Udaar Hain Apaar Kahooat(u) Hain||
translation: One cannot know Thy limit, O Infinitely Glorious Lord! Thou art the Giver of all learning, therefore Thou art called Boundless.

gurmukhi: hwQI kI pRkwr pl pwCY phucq qwih cItI kI icMAwr pihly hI sunIAqu hYN ]4]256]
transliteration: Haathoo Koo Poukaar Pal Paachhai Pahouchat Taah(i) Chootoo Koo Chinghaar Pahile Hoo Sounooat(u) Haioo||4||256||
translation: The cry of an elephant reaches Thee after some time, but the trumpet of an ant is heard by Thee before it.4.256

gurmukhi: kyqy ieMdR duAwr kyqy bHmw muK cwr kyqy kiRsnw Avqwr kyqy rwm khIAqu hYN ]
transliteration: Kete Indra Duaar Kete Brahmaa Mouch Chaar Kete Krishnaa Avtaar Kete Raam Kahooat(u) Hain||
translation: There are many Indras, many four-headded Brahmas, many incarnations of Krishna and many called Ram at His Gate.

gurmukhi: kyqy sis rwsI kyqy sUrj pRkwsI kyqy muMfIAw audwsI jog duAwr khIAqu hYN ]
transliteration: Kete Sas(i) Raasoo Kete Sooraj Prakaasoo Kete Mounndooaa Udaasoo Jog Duaar Kahooat(u) Hain||
translation: There are many moons, many signs of Zodiac and many illuminating suns, there are many ascetics, stoics and Yogis consuming their bodies with austerity at His Gate.

gurmukhi: kyqy mhwdIn kyqy ibAws sy pRbIn kyqy kumyr kulIn kyqy jC khIAqu hYN ]
transliteration: Kete Mahaadoon Kete Biaas Se Praboon Kete Koumer Kuloon Kete Jachh Kahooat(u) Hain||
translation: There are many Muhammads, many adepts like Vyas, many Kumars (Kubers) and many belonging to high clans and many are called Yakshas.

gurmukhi: krq hYN ibcwr pY n pUrn ko pwvY pwr qwhI qy Apwr inrwpwr lhIAqu hYN ]5]257]
transliteration: Karat Hain Bichaar Pain A Pooran Ko Paavai Paar Taahi Te Apaar Niraadhar Lahooat(u) Hain||5||257||
translation: All of them reflect upon Him, but none can know His limit, therefore they consider the Infinite Lord Supportless.5.257.

gurmukhi: pUrn Avqwr inrwDwr hY n pwrwvwr pweIAY n pwr pY Apwr kY bKwnIAY ]
transliteration: Pooran Avtaar Niraadhaar Hai Na Paaraavaar Paaooai Na Paar Pai Apaar Kai Bakhaanooai||
translation: He is Perfect Entity, Supportless and without Limits, His end is unknown, therefore He is described as Infinite.

gurmukhi: Ad√çY AibnwsI prm pUrn pRkwsI mhw rUp hUM ky rwsI hYN AnwsI kY kY mwnIAY ]
transliteration: Advai Abinaasoo Param Pooran Prakaasoo Mahaa Roop Hoon Ke Raasoo Hain Anaasoo Kai Kai Maanooai||
translation: He is Non-dual, Immortal, Supreme, Perfectly Lustrous, Treasure of Supreme Beauty and deemed eternal.

gurmukhi: jMqR hUM n jwq jw kI bwp hUM n mwie qw kI pUrn pRBw kI su Ctw kY AnumwnIAY ]
transliteration: Jantra Hoon Na Jaat Jaa Koo Baap Hoon Na Maae Taa Koo Pooran Prabhaa Koo Su Chhataa Kai Anoumaanooai||
translation: He is without Yantra (mystical diagram) and caste, without father and mother and presumed as the splash of Perfect beauty.

gurmukhi: qyj hUM ko qMqR hYN ik rwjsI ko jMqR hYN ik mohnI ko mMqR hYN injMqR kY kY jwnIAY ]6]258]
transliteration: Tej Hoon Ko Tantra Hain Ki Raajasiko Jantra Hain Ki Mohaniko Mantra Hain Nijantra Kai Kai Jaaneeai||6||258||
translation: It cannot be said whether He is the Abode of Splendour of political mechanism or the incantaion of an enchantress or the inspiration of all of them. 6.258.

gurmukhi: qyj hUM ko qru hYN ik rwjsI ko sru hYN ik su`Dqw ko Gru hYN ik is`Dqw kI swr hYN ]
transliteration: Tej Hoon Ko Tar(u) Hain Ki Raajasoo Ko Sar(u) Hain Ki Suddhataa Ko Ghar(u) Hain Ki Siddhataa Koo Saar Hain||
translation: Is He the tree of Splendour? Is He the tank of activity? Is He the Abode of Purity? Is He the essence of Powers?
